sections.title: Introduction
sections.body: The POTD is a fixed deposit scheme offered via India Post, providing guaranteed returns over tenures of 1, 2, 3, or 5 years. It closely resembles a bank FD but with government backing.[^12][^13][^14][^15]

sections.title: How the Scheme Works
sections.body:
- Lump sum invested for a selected term.
- Current interest rates (as of Sept. 2025): 1yr—6.9%, 2yr—7.0%, 3yr—7.1%, 5yr—7.5% (compounded quarterly, paid annually).
- Minimum investment: ₹1,000 (multiples of ₹100); no upper limit.
- 5-year deposit eligible for Section 80C tax deduction; interest is fully taxable.[^13][^14][^16]

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria
sections.body:
- All resident individuals (adults, joint holders up to 3, minors via guardian).
- Not open to NRIs, HUFs, trusts, or organizations.[^14][^17][^13]

sections.title: How to Apply
sections.body:
- Available at any India Post branch; some authorized banks may offer POTD.
- Provide application form, KYC (PAN, Aadhaar, address proof), and deposit.
- Account can be transferred between post offices.[^16][^13][^14]

sections.title: Important Points to Note
sections.body:
- Multiple accounts allowed.
- Premature withdrawals allowed after 6 months, with interest penalty.
- Nomination facility available.
- 5-year TD qualifies for tax benefits; TDS applicable above limit.[^13][^14][^16]

sections.title: Useful Links
sections.body:
- India Post Saving Schemes: indiapost.gov.in/banking-services/saving
- Government Portal: myscheme.gov.in.[^11][^18]
